title.narrative: Soudan du Sud - Projet de mobilisation des recettes non pétrolières et responsabilité au Soudan du Sud (NORMA- SS)
South Sudan - Non-Oil Revenue Mobilisation and Accountability in South Sudan Project (NORMA-SS)

description.narrative: Les bénéficiaires directs du projet sont les Ministères des finances et de la planification, plus précisément l’Office national des recettes (NRA), la Direction générale des impôts, les services du Trésor, du Budget, de l’Audit interne, de la Dette et de la Coordination de l'aide, l'Administration fiscale et les Douanes, ainsi que la Chambre nationale de l'audit, la Commission des comptes publics, de même que les offices des recettes au niveau des États. Ce projet profitera au Gouvernement et à la population du Soudan du Sud à travers le renforcement des faibles capacités humaines et institutionnelles existant dans le secteur de l’administration des recettes non pétrolières aux niveaux national et des États, ainsi qu’à travers le renforcement de leurs systèmes de gestion des finances publiques.

The direct beneficiaries of the project are the Ministries of Finance and Planning, more specifically the National Revenue Office (NRA), the General Directorate of Taxes, the Treasury, Budget, Internal Audit and Debt Services and the Aid Coordination, the Tax Administration and Customs, as well as the National Audit Chamber, the Public Accounts Committee, as well as the State Revenue Offices. This project will benefit the Government and the people of South Sudan by strengthening the existing weak human and institutional capacity in the non-oil revenue administration sector at the national and state levels, as well as through the strengthening of their public financial management systems.

Le projet de mobilisation des recettes non pétrolières et responsabilité au Soudan du Sud a été conçu en raison de la nécessité d'adopter des mesures immédiates en vue de réduire la dépendance vis-à-vis du pétrole, de stimuler les recettes non pétrolières et de renforcer le contrôle des dépenses. En effet, les revenus du pétrole, dont dépend l'économie du pays, se sont effondrés suite à la baisse des prix intervenue depuis juillet 2014, entraînant un déficit budgétaire représentant 30 % du PIB en 2015. De plus, il s'agit d'un projet d'appui institutionnel financé à la fois par des ressources sous forme de dons et de prêts, qui vise à compléter d'autres interventions des bailleurs de fonds, destinées à combler les besoins en capacité dans deux domaines interdépendants, notamment en renforçant les capacités au niveau des recettes non pétrolières tant au niveau national qu'au niveau des États, tout en améliorant le contrôle financier, de même que les fonctions de transparence et de responsabilité. Le coût du projet est estimé à 11,833 millions d'UC et sera financé à hauteur de 10,65 millions d'UC. Il comporte trois composantes qui se renforcent mutuellement : i) amélioration de la mobilisation des ressources intérieures dans le secteur non pétrolier ; ii) renforcement du contrôle financier, de la responsabilité et des mécanismes de contrôle et iii) gestion du projet.

The non-oil revenue mobilization and accountability project in South Sudan was designed because of the need to take immediate steps to reduce dependency on oil, boost non-oil revenues and reduce oil revenues strengthen control of expenditure. Indeed, oil revenues, on which the country's economy depends, collapsed following the price decline since July 2014, resulting in a budget deficit of 30% of GDP in 2015. In addition, the present is a project institutional support, funded by both grant and loan resources, to complement other donor interventions designed to address capacity needs in two interrelated areas, including capacity building at the country level, non-oil revenues at both the national and state levels, while improving financial control, transparency and accountability. The project cost is estimated at UA 11.833 million and will be financed at UA 10.65 million. It has three mutually reinforcing components: (i) Improved domestic resource mobilization in the non-oil sector; ii) Strengthening financial control, accountability and control mechanisms; and iii) Project management.

L'objectif de développement global du projet est de promouvoir une croissance économique durable et plus forte par l'accroissement de la mobilisation des ressources intérieures et le renforcement de la responsabilité dans l'utilisation des ressources publiques.

The overall development objective of the project is to promote sustainable and stronger economic growth by increasing domestic resource mobilization and enhancing accountability for the use of public resources.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF FINANCE AND ECONOMIC PLANNING
Ministère des Finances et de la Planification

mailing-address.narrative: African Development Bank Group Headquarters Avenue Joseph Anoma 01 BP 1387 Abidjan 01, Côte d'Ivoire

title.narrative: In-country training programme developed for customs officers on import valuation and HS codes harmonization (customs officers trained)
Capacity of MoFP staff in core areas of FMAA enhanced (budgeting, accounting, FMIS, procurement, audit) - staff trained
Number of tax administration staff trained in tax accounting, tax audit and investigation
Number of state tax officers trained on new non-oil tax administration standard operation procedures
IA and NAC Staff trained on IFMIS and non-oil tax audit
Total tax as a percentage of GDP
Number of state tax structures established and rendered operational
In-country training programme developed for customs officers on import valuation and HS codes harmonization (customs officers trained) - of which women
Capacity of MoFP staff in core areas of FMAA enhanced (budgeting, accounting, FMIS, procurement, audit) - women staff trained
Non-oil revenues as percentage of GDP
Number of tax administration staff trained in tax accounting, tax audit and investigation - of which women
Imports and customs revenue collection data improved
IA and NAC Staff trained on IFMIS and non-oil tax audit - of which women

actual.value: A National Taxpayer Education programme to support both national and state government revenue modernization and tax policy has been developed

title.narrative: National Revenue Authority (NRA) implementation plan rolled out

target.value: Commissioner General (CG) appointed and NRA Board and structures operational in 2018

actual.value: A new Commissioner General had been recruited and was in place since September 2020

target.value: GATC refurbished and training programme developed by 2019

actual.value: Achieved: The equipment computers and furniture provided the Government Accountancy Training Centre (GATC) has enabled it to be operational
Cancelled: This activity is has been cancelled due to insufficient project funds

title.narrative: PAC members trained in oversight function

target.value: PAC benefit from training programme over 3 year period

actual.value: In progress: Related activities are yet to commence although the TOR is being developed
In progress: TOR developed and a short list of consultants had been developed, however further progress has stalled due to the impact of COVID-19

title.narrative: Use of Financial Management Information System-FMIS

target.value: FMIS budget module activated and access to FMIS expanded

actual.value: In progress: The budget unit continues to use an IFMIS system, however the mission team recommends a review of the system

title.narrative: Quality and timeline of annual statements (PEFA PI 25)
Effectiveness in collection of tax revenues(PEFA PI-15)
Timeliness and regularity of accounts reconciliation (PEFA PI-22)
Aggregate Revenue outturn compared to original approved budget. (PEFA PI-3)

target.value: Financial statements of 2018 audited by NAC

actual.value: Related activities are yet to commence

title.narrative: Production of International Public Sector Accounting Standards (IPSAS) compliant financial statements

actual.value: Slow progress: Reports are generated but are on excel and are yet to be IPSAS compliant

title.narrative: Human Resources and Administration structure established

target.value: Human Resources structure developed and implemented by 2018

actual.value: The NRA HR structure has been approved and is operational with all departments and units defined. Some of the commissioners appointed, the other staff recruitment to man the various directorate is yet to be finalized

title.narrative: Information and communication systems for tax administration upgraded

actual.value: The procurement for the tax system was considered too sophisticated for the country given the challenges with electricity, internet connectivity and skills to man the system. Based on this, the project’s support has been revised to support the operationalization of DTIS
